meanings.definition: The quality or state of being perfectly vertical or straight.
meanings.sent1: The plumbness of the tower was impressive, standing tall and straight.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter checked the plumbness of the wall using a level.
meanings.sent3: The plumbness of the tree made it look like a giant ruler in the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her posture had the plumbness of a soldier at attention.
meanings.sent5: The plumbness of the skyscraper against the clear sky was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The act of measuring the depth of water or determining the verticality of a surface using a plumb line.
meanings.sent1: The sailor used plumbness to measure how deep the ocean was.
meanings.sent2: The construction worker relied on plumbness to ensure the walls were straight.
meanings.sent3: The fisherman's plumbness revealed the lake was deeper than expected.
meanings.sent4: The plumbness of the well indicated a plentiful water supply below.
meanings.sent5: The plumbness of the cliff was crucial for the rock climber's safety.

meanings.definition: The state of being in alignment with a standard or ideal.
meanings.sent1: Her artwork achieved a level of plumbness that impressed the critics.
meanings.sent2: The teacher praised the student for the plumbness of their essay structure.
meanings.sent3: The plumbness of the cake layers made it look like a professional bakery creation.
meanings.sent4: The plumbness of his golf swing improved after hours of practice.
meanings.sent5: The plumbness of the building design met all the architectural standards.
